attributes.action: Make UK standard parking spaces bigger.
attributes.background: Parking space is a premium in most cities and towns. However, most spaces are barely wider than a vehicle. A UK standard parking space is 2.4m wide, by 4.8m. The average family car is 2.1m x 4.8m. Park perfectly and you get 150mm either side to open a door. This is not enough for most vehicle users.
attributes.additional_details:
You should be able to park your vehicle and get in or out without struggling. You should also not have to worry about potential damage which can often be sustained in your absence. Causing needless cost and loss of earnings, maybe even insurance hikes. Town and city planners have overlooked this for years, as have Supermarkets and retail parks.
It's time, as consumers, that we took a stand and put the onus onto those profiting from our misery.
Your vote could help to change this.

attributes.action: Send out a booklet to every household in the UK about leaving the EU
attributes.background: The government spent £9 million of taxpayers money informing the public they wanted to remain in the EU and why. The people rejected the governments view and gave an instruction to leave the EU  . The government must now spend an equal amount on a Brexit booklet explaining the advantages of Brexit
attributes.additional_details:
The public are being bombarded with scaremongering from the media and politicians of the damage Brexit will cause to our country.
It is time for the government to provide a booklet promoting the positives of being an independent nation again and set out its vision of the future for our trade, workers and civil rights, security and the revival of our fishing fleets. 

The government must act fairly and provide a Brexit booklet on the advantages of leaving the single market and customs union

attributes.action: Extend Sunday trading hours
attributes.background: To increase the trading hours to match the other 6 days of the week would increase revenue and employment. Sunday trading laws are out dated and the product of an old fashioned mindset.

attributes.action: Change the law and policy concerning box junctions.
attributes.background: If you stop in a box junction you are breaking the law and will receive a fine. There should be advance road sign warnings, and visual help to indicate how much space is after the junction. Drivers should be given more leniency if a vehicle enters the junction by 2 meters.

attributes.action: Urge the FA to withdraw the England team from the World Cup this summer.
attributes.background: The chemical attack on the streets of Salisbury is little short of a declaration of war on Britain's right to offer safe haven to whomsoever it chooses.  Our response must be much bolder than it has so far been.  Putin must not be allowed to use the world cup to normalise his tyranny.
attributes.additional_details: This petition seeks a debate in Parliament whose aim is to persuade the government to urge the FA to withdraw the England Football Team from the World Cup in Russia this summer and to discuss with others who have qualifying teams the possibility of doing the same.

attributes.action: ban homework
attributes.background:
i don't like homework, students don't like homework, teachers don't like homework, so why is homework a thing? we don't need it, so lets get rid of it!
it prevents social building of students, and increases the workload heavily on teachers. homework is bad for everyone, the recipient, and producer.
attributes.additional_details: i hate homework, so let's get rid of it

attributes.action: Give parents paid leave for school closure/sickness for their children
attributes.background: I find it ever so unfair when you work hard to support your children, children are far more likely to pick up bugs and illnesses, parent should not have to lose pay or take holiday to cover the time off to look their child it should paid by the employer
attributes.additional_details: My daughter was recently admitted into hospital, she was there for a week, I had to take it as holiday because i would lose a lot of money if I took it as sick.... firstly I’m not sick and secondly it’s not a holiday, I should be entitled to get paid time off for my child care, but it must be proven time off obviously, I however took it as holiday as I had no choice, this I feel is unfair as you should no be punished for a child sickness, I would work if I was ill, but children are different

attributes.action: Make 11/11/2018 a non-trading day in remembrance of the First World War
attributes.background: There have been global commemorations to acknowledge the debt owed by all of us to all those affected by the terrible events of World War One. The Centenary of the ending of WW1 falls on Sunday 11/11/18. there can be a no better way to show our respect by ceasing all trading on that day.

attributes.action: Impose sanctions on America until they change their laws regarding firearms
attributes.background: Since the start of 2018, 18 school shootings have occurred in the USA - averaging to three every week. This is as much a gun control issue as it is a mental health issue. We call upon the government to impose some sanctions upon the US until they DO something to control this devastating situation.

attributes.action: Ban homework for Year 11 students a few months before the GCSE exams
attributes.background: I think that homework should be banned because it gives us little time to revise. It takes up most of our time at home that we have after school, and leaves us with only maybe 1 hour to revise after the homework. One hour a day is not enough for GCSE students.

attributes.action: Make plastic packaging show images of the damage they cause to the environment
attributes.background: Putting images or warnings about the damage caused to our environment, particularly marine life, by single use plastic bags and packaging will deter people from buying these items and push large producers of such items to use biodegradable alternatives. We cannot let nature suffer our waste anymore.
attributes.additional_details: Walking through supermarkets we often pick things up for their convenience without giving a second thought to what happens to the packaging once we’re done with it. Recently however, we have seen shocking footage of marine life facing the consequences of human waste such as a mother whale not wanting to leave behind her dead calf, poisoned by plastics. This cannot go on. Seeing the devastation caused as you’re about to pick up something wrapped in plastic might make you think twice about it.

attributes.action: Select members of the BBC board in the same way that juries are chosen
attributes.background: We believe that the BBC should be unbiased. There have been many accusations recently that there is right wing bias. In the past there have been accusation of left wing bias. At present government ministers decide who is appointed to the BBC board. This gives rise to conflicts of interest.

attributes.action: Investigate the risk to health from formaldehyde insulation in 1m older UK homes
attributes.background: As a social housing tenant in a former council owned property, now managed by a housing trust, I only discovered that it's cavity wall insulation contains formaldehyde (a known carcinogenic) when contractors negligently blew this noxious powder into my home & exposed us to its ongoing health risks!
attributes.additional_details:
Upon exposure to this atomised irritant, it was blasted into my home under 3,000 psi of machine fed pressure, I initially suffered a severe burning sensation in my eyes, nose, throat & chest, which continued to cause much discomfort for approx. 6 weeks afterwards; some of my neighbours were similarly affected.

On researching the topic I've discovered up to 1m older UK homes may be at risk of this hidden toxin & the EU's listed this substance as a contributory factor to leukemia & nasal cancer.

attributes.action: Make St George's Day in England and St Andrew's day in Wales public holidays
attributes.background: Scotland and Northern Ireland both get public holidays for their patron saint, why should England and Wales not get the same privilege?

attributes.action: Increase maternity SMP (33 weeks) to match national minimum wage
attributes.background: UK is ranked one of the lowest when it comes to decent maternity pay. SMP is below minimum wage, why? With all the things we are doing for equality and empowerment of women, maternity pay is being ignored.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to the financial strain more women are not returning back to work or they are returning back to work earlier than they need to and miss out on bonding with their new born. This causes us to lose skilled women at the workplace and not giving importance to an upbringing of a child.

Is it fair that SMP is below minimum wage? Why is it not being matched? 

There are so many benefits that a change to this can bring, families will be in a better financial situation and more likely to return work.

attributes.action: Abolish Political Parties and create a collective body of independent MPs.
attributes.background: Great ideas can come from anyone. The possibility that a great idea will fall by the wayside due to some in-built bias of the current Party political/adversarial setup is wrong. Our current Parliamentary system encourages and rewards political bullying (from the whips) and loyalty to the Party line.
attributes.additional_details: Independent MPs would strengthen the relationship (and possibly form new types of relationships) between MPs and their constituents. An MP who today finds it necessary to follow the Party line, which in many cases is against their constituents beliefs, will find it easier to be more in tune with the people they represent and 100% accountable to the same. We have had enough of adversarial wrangling and it is time to try something new - a collective Parliament as is evident anywhere else in nature

attributes.action: Introduce compulsory maximum speed limiters on all vehicles driven on UK roads.
attributes.background: Most production cars & motorcycles manufactured today are capable of speeds well in excess of 70 mph with some high performance models able to reach up to 155mph.
attributes.additional_details: Criminals ignore speed limits and we regularly see news reports of police pursuing stolen high performance cars in excess of 100mph with some causing deaths and injuries. It is illegal to drive above the speed limit. Why are cars that can travel over the maximum legal speed limit allowed on our roads? The new range of Ford Fiestas have maximum speeds of between 99 and 121mph (Autocar). I am calling for compulsory top speed  limiters to be fitted to all vehicles used on UK roads to save lives.

attributes.action: Ban unconditional offers for entrance to university
attributes.background: Universities have embarked on a race to the bottom in admissions standards in a now liberalised marketplace. To benefit society, the free market needs a framework of rules within which to operate. The government should legislate to prohibit this harmful practice, which is damaging pupil attainment.
attributes.additional_details:
The number of unconditional offers for entrance to university made to 18 year olds in England, Wales and N.I. is exploding:

2013      3,000
2014    12,100
2015    23,400
2016    36,800
2017    51,600

UCAS recorded one in six applicants receiving one or more unconditional offers in 2017.

Such offers remove the incentive for pupils to work, leading to lower attainment at A Level, as UCAS' own research has demonstrated: see pages 18-9 of https://www.ucas.com/file/71796/download?token=D4uuSzur.

attributes.action: Philip Hammond to withdraw comments on disabled workforce lowering productivity
attributes.background: On the 6.12.17 the chancellor said to MPs at the Treasury Select Committee: "It is almost certainly the case that by increasing participation in the workforce for example of disabled people[...]may have had an impact on overall productivity measurements."
attributes.additional_details:
Rather than scapegoating disabled people through unfounded simplistic claims around a pretty complex matter Mr Hammond would benefit from reading this DWP commissioned report:

https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20130314010347/http:/research.dwp.gov.uk/asd/asd5/rports2005-2006/rrep400.pdf&ved=0ahUKEwj-yP3UlYrYAhVI4KQKHd_mBpc4ChAWCCowAg&usg=AOvVaw3_mgkcqqS4_rwRlzoHoH3N

attributes.action: Highlights of all Test Matches (cricket) involving the Home Nations free to air
attributes.background: Currently only England home test match highlights have to be free to air, which means that the achievements of our cricketers whilst abroad cannot to seen by the majority of fans.
attributes.additional_details:
The actual changed needed it to add all Test Matches (cricket) involving the Home Nations to Category B in the Ofcom Code on Sports and Other Listed and Designated Events.

Sport England’s latest active people survey shows that over the past decade (since, coincidence or not, cricket was last on free-to-air TV) the number of people aged over 16 who play it at least once a week has dropped from 195,200 to 158,500 and the number who play at least once a month has dropped from 380,300 to 278,600.

attributes.action: Introduce legislation to protect students from universities and letting agencies
attributes.background: Started by a student who has had exposure to injustice in regards to university, letting agencies and landlords. University is stressful as it is, let alone overpaying for a property that isn't fit for purpose. I want to make life bearable for students who want to better themselves.
attributes.additional_details:
It should be illegal for:

- Letting agencies and landlords to let below par properties for high rent.

- Universities who knowingly deliver below par education and still charge high fees.

- Letting agencies and landlords to overcharge student deposits.

One in four students suffer with mental health problems. Students are currently vulnerable and have no protection from the government against these flaws.  Students need to be taken seriously and be seen as the future of this country.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health Awareness Training Mandatory for All Employers and Managers
attributes.background: Mental health problems have a greater impact on people’s ability to work than any other group of disorders. At the moment, we have no mandatory protocol, training or support for people who suffer with Mental Illness and this usually ends in dismissal by a manager or resignation of an employee.
attributes.additional_details: I, as well as thousands of other people in the UK, find it hard to talk out about Mental Health, especially when our Job is concerned. We can’t come to terms with telling our Manager as we fear for our job. People suffering with Depression, Anxiety or any other Mental Health condition should be supported at work. This Petition is to make Employers and Managers carry out the correct training to educate them on what we go through on a daily basis and ways to avoid our conditions spiralling

attributes.action: Request that any Brexit bill be itemised and debated in parliament and public.
attributes.background:
Since the vote to leave the EU there have been multiple figures given in the press over any divorce bill varying between 20 - 100 billion pounds. 
We the undersigned demand that prior to any exit agreement the divorce bill should be itemised and made available for parliamentary and public scrutiny.
attributes.additional_details: Daily updates in the national and world press regarding the so called Brexit " divorce bill".

attributes.action: Hold a Public Inquiry into >45000 extra deaths linked to austerity since 2010
attributes.background: A recent study published in the BMJ showed a correlation between cuts to social and healthcare funding and higher than expected national mortality rates since 2010. A Public Inquiry should be held in order to determine whether Government Austerity measures have led to an increase in death rate.
attributes.additional_details:
Long term under funding of health and social care services has led to widespread suffering, a decline physical and mental health and vulnerable people being put at risk. Lack of funding may also be responsible for >45000 deaths since 2010. If this is the case, harmful government action and policy must be reversed and responsible politicians held to account over these deaths.

Study: http://bmjopen.bmj.com/content/7/11/e017722

attributes.action: Ban farm machinery using the A55 during peak commuting hours
attributes.background: Slow-moving farm machinery is often causing delays during peak times for commuters. This has also often led to accidents causing lane/road closures and further/longer delays, as well as a drain on resources and a increased carbon emissions.

attributes.action: Change Corporation tax so that only UK costs can be used to offset profits.
attributes.background: In the last week it has been reported that Ebay UK and AirBnB have both paid significantly less corporation tax than would seem fair, both have acted within the law that allows costs from abroad to be used against profits achieved in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: By only allowing costs incurred in the UK for UK tax purposes this would level the playing field, deter replacing of UK jobs with jobs in lower cost countries and improve tax revenues. This would also align with PAYE tax rules.

attributes.action: Make it requirement for takeaways & restaurants to display food hygiene ratings
attributes.background: As a country we should enforce ALL places where food is handled to display their food hygiene rating. Food hygiene is crucial and diseases and infections can occur from "poor hygiene" - we as paying customers have the right to know how hygienic our food is respectively.
attributes.additional_details:
It is a known fact that poor food hygiene is associated with serious cases of food poisoning and this could mean having to seek medical evaluation, if you have ever suffered from this you would know it is an unpleasant experience, and it is commonly associated with with pathogens such as Salmonella.
As paying customers we deserve the right to know the standard of hygiene that out food was prepared in respectively. 
This should also motivate those poor establishments to up their standards.

attributes.action: The environment to be taught as a compulsory subject throughout school life.
attributes.background: All the good we do now with regards to litter picking, recycling, and on environmental issues will be a complete waste of time if we do not start to educate everyone from the year dot. We need to stop the rot so that our future generations will make a better job of looking after our world.
attributes.additional_details: Most of the people reading this will never have known what it is like to be brought up in a clean and pristine country. If we want to change this for our future generations we have to start NOW, and as with everything in life it begins with education. Many children are shown and taught to do the right thing before they start school, sadly many more are not because their parents themselves were not taught. We urgently need to stop this repetitive cycle which is why l have started this petition.

attributes.action: Ban the use of plastic film wrappers that are not biodegradable.
attributes.background: Many plastic film wrappers such as those used when mailing magazines, are not biodegradable. Yet materials that could replace such wrappers are readily available. The existing wrappers cause, at the very least, an eye-sore when blown around our countryside. At the extreme they kill wild creatures.

attributes.action: Make Letting Fees illegal in England, like they are in Scotland
attributes.background: The fees letting agents charge have gotten out of hand, you can lay out a lot of hard cash, and lose it if you fail the reference, credit, or guarantor, stages of applying for a Tenancy, the cost of the Tenancy itself can be ridiculous, it's illegal in Scotland, why not in England?
attributes.additional_details:
I'm looking to move from my present address, (I have social housing) boy was I shocked, when I saw the cost of fees involved in doing so in the private sector. Fees have been illegal in Scotland since 2012, so why is it not the same in England? 
Is it because so many MP's are Landlords (123 was the count in 2017). They won't want to pick up the tab themselves, like they have to in Scotland for these checks, let's force their hand.

attributes.action: UK Government to work with the devolved assemblies to create UK free bus travel
attributes.background: Those who are 60 years and over can get free bus travel in Wales Scotland Northern Ireland and London while the rest of UK citizens have to pay. This surely is unfair on those of us who rely on bus travel for work and leisure in England. Please sign this petition to bring in a national standard
attributes.additional_details: Many people aged 60 and over struggle to pay the cost of bus travel. It makes sense to bring in a UK standard for all .This would also help with road congestion and therefore help to reduce pollution from car emissions. It should also improve bus services due to the extra demand by this age group.  Many other countries  actively promote the use of public transport to free up congested roads especially with  Hydrogen and Electric powered public transport.Cleaner air makes  a better environment

attributes.action: Government needs to require harassment training for late night venue licenses
attributes.background: By training staff once a year, venues can ensure that staff know what to do and who to report to, ensuring women feel safe.This can be provided by existing trainers, and has been piloted in Southwark council. Training costs, which are low, could be covered by the venues.
attributes.additional_details: I work with women who experience abuse and see an increase in abuse to women especially in late night venues. Government needs to address the rising levels of sexual harassment that women experience in late night bars and clubs, by changing licensing laws to require landlords and venue owners to train staff on how to respond to sexual harassment complaints effectively.  A change in the law will ensure a clear message to those who harass others, and to those who just want the harassment to stop.

attributes.action: Return funding for sixth form students for the last three financial years
attributes.background: The amount £135 million in 2014/15, £132 million in 2015/16 and £106 million in 2016/17 that was not spent would be invaluable in improving the quality of our education, and colleges across England have joined this campaign in order to claim it back.
attributes.additional_details: Unable to provide essential opportunities deprives state educated students the ability to gain crucial skills which more advantaged students in private schools and colleges have already developed. As a result, the social mobility which has been a goal of every recent government is undermined from the start. This means we simply cannot aspire to achieve what our more privileged peers will achieve except in exceptional circumstances.

attributes.action: Change the TV licensing law so that your TV licence covers you away from home.
attributes.background:
If you have a licence and travel on a bus whilst watching iPlayer you are covered. If you live or holiday in a caravan you are covered. 
If you stay in a hotel, B&B or holiday home you ARE NOT and require the owner of that establishment to have a licence.
attributes.additional_details:
You could be potentially breaking the law without even realising it.
I am one of those many law abiding citizens who have to work away from home due to lack of suitable work in my home area. I own a TV licence at home. During the week I rent a cottage off my employer. I have no utility bills, do not have the right to vote in this constituency and I am not registered with a GP here and yet I am required, by law, to have a TV licence - Why?
If you think that this should be changed please vote.

attributes.action: Make it an offence for people who park in parent & child spaces without child
attributes.background: Having a child myself when out and about is stressful enough. When you come to park your car in parent & child space it would be nice not to see so many people using the spaces that are reserved for people who have children.
attributes.additional_details:
This morning I witnessed 3 different cars parked in the parent and child spaces after I drove round for 5 minutes trying to find one. Eventually I saw a lone lady get into her car who didn’t have a child. She eventually pulled out the space and whilst I was unloading the pushchair, the car that was parked next to me, had four adults walk to it and get in.
It’s extremley useful to have the extra space either side of the car when you have a car seat to get out.

attributes.action: Make those with registered assistance dogs automatically eligible for PIP.
attributes.background: According to the Governments own website PIP should be paid to those who are financially penalised because of there disability or long term illness. Many people with assistance dogs actually get turned down for PIP because of the dog and the help they give, this is not right and needs to change.

attributes.action: Remove Widows Parents Allowance as an income on Universal Credit Claims
attributes.background: Universal Credit claims currently see Widows Parents Allowance as an income. Therefore any claim made by a widow is penalised resulting in the total amount of Widows Parents Allowance being deducted from their claim resulting in a far lesser payment of Universal Credit.
attributes.additional_details:
Widows Parents Allowance is exactly that, an allowance to help a widowed parent support and provide for their young children following the loss of the child's/children's parent.
I alone will not be able to make changes to the Universal Credit criteria, but feel strongly that the inclusion of Widows Parents Allowance in any Universal Credit claim should be reconsidered. Support should be given by our Government to those trying to better themselves following the devastating loss of a husband/wife

attributes.action: NHS access should not be part of any trade negotiations with any foreign power.
attributes.background: The NHS, since its coming into being in 1948 has been a, perhaps THE,  social cement even in times of national division. It is an institution that is for the people and of the people and should be protected as our prime national asset.
attributes.additional_details: Poll upon poll has shown the depth of feeling the British people have for the NHS.  Most recently. 60,000 marched in defence of the Service.

attributes.action: Rule out involving our NHS in a trade deal with the US
attributes.background: Theresa May has refused to rule out trading away our NHS in a deal with the USA. We want to show that that is not the will of the people.

attributes.action: Parents should have the right to choose who looks after their children.
attributes.background: Parents do not have the right to pay a trusted friend to look after their children.
attributes.additional_details: For low earners without family around them, and with childcare costs so high, a lot of parents end up having to work night shifts so the other parent can look after the children. Not a healthy situation for any family!

attributes.action: Equality for men. Ban the use of urinals. Men should not be expected to use them
attributes.background: Women are able to urinate in private so why are men men expected to use urinals?  Yes, cubicles are also provided in most cases but they are typically being used by somebody that needs to do the alternative.  Men are under pressure to urinate next to another man despite the privacy concern.
attributes.additional_details: The smells that are emitted from the majority of urinals are awful. In addition, spare a thought for the cleaners. Also, banning the use of urinals would save an enormous quantity of water as the urinals typically flush automatically even when they are not being used. The time has come to provide equality for men and give us some privacy.

attributes.action: Prevent false cures for autism being sold to people in the UK
attributes.background: I am concerned about the number of parents being tricked into giving their children bleach solutions, often marketed as MMS (Miracle Mineral solutions), as an autism cure. It can lead to severe injuries or death. I urge the government to prevent the sale of false cures.
attributes.additional_details: Autism cannot be cured and this practice is seeing serious injuries to children, and may result in deaths. Turps and bleach have their place as cleaners, but as doctors have stated "Chlorine dioxide causes abdominal cramps, vomiting and diarrhoea. If you drink it on a long-term basis it causes inflammation of your gut-lining, stomach, oesophagus and intestines and eventually death" https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/brit-kids-forced-drink-bleach-11924623

attributes.action: Buy British made Mechanised Infantry Vehicles for the army
attributes.background: Britain currently has a major trade deficit, especially in manufactured goods. the country's engineering capability and capacity has been severely degraded over the past thirty years, in part because of successive refusals by the British government to support and encourage manufacturing in Britain.

attributes.action: Use all National Lottery profits to help fund National Health Service
attributes.background: It is clear that our NHS is overstretched and desperately requires additional funding. There is, in my opinion, no more worthy a cause for National Lottery money to be spent on. It is my belief that tens of thousands additional tickets would be purchased for this cause.
attributes.additional_details: Having put this idea to many people over recent months the general consensus is that most people, like me, would be happy to invest £10 per week if we knew the money was going to the NHS.

attributes.action: Ban working MPs and donors of over £5,000 to a political party from honours.
attributes.background: Implementing this ban will reduce the chances of people using their position to get honours, reduce corruption and help those who truly deserve honours receive them.
attributes.additional_details:
Working MPs are a special case compared to working musicians, sportsmen etc. 

Only MPs have the ability to directly affect the government that is in power and the laws within which we all live under and therefore require special rules.

Wealthy people should not use their money to influence a democratically elected government.

attributes.action: To make it a legal human right for every UK citizen to have a home.
attributes.background: Homelessness is increasing, human beings should not be living on the streets in the 21st Century. The United Kingdom is a first world country and as a civilised advanced country we should no longer tolerate homelessness for any reason.

attributes.action: Pay reparations to Caribbean descendants of slavery.
attributes.background: The British government owes Caribbean people reparations for the horrors carried out on black people during slavery. The sugar cane plantations helped to fund many cooperations still in existence today, these families cam be traced and great Britain should be held accountable for its atrocities.

attributes.action: Adopt a stance of permanent military neutrality, as a nation state.
attributes.background: Military intervention has been largely unpopular and entirely ineffective at ending the issues it claims plague the world. Conquest is forbidden as a peremptory norm, aggression is mostly too. Self defense implies neutrality, saving 1-1.5% of GDP each year to spend on other sectors of the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the time of the Peace of Westphalia, the military has lost two of its three purposes. Internal revolt and crime being dealt with by local police forces, the right of conquest being outlawed per jus cogens, only self defense remains. Neutrality is a natural and rational position when self defense is the only legal use of arms. 

Largely, neutral countries such as Switzerland, Austria, Ireland, Finland spend 0.5-1% of GDP on their militaries. That equates to £20-30bn in savings per year.

attributes.action: To require each energy supplier to set a standard Standing Charge across tariffs
attributes.background: Energy suppliers offer multiple tariffs, which are likely to have different combinations of unit price and daily standing charge. Making an informed decision about WHICH tariff and/or supplier to use is made more complex by having these differences. Unit only variables would simplify that choice.
attributes.additional_details: I've just been through the process again, spent hours doing many calculations and making comparisons between, not only one energy supplier's tariffs, but also between multiple suppliers, it was confusing and impossible to make an informed choice. I consulted acquaintances, friends and family, who all agreed. Having just ONE standard daily standing charge would make such choice simpler by removing one variable. Switching may be ideal in principle, but is often a leap in the dark for many people.

attributes.action: Amend the National Lottery licence to specify the Operator should be a Charity.
attributes.background:
The UK National Lottery operator Camelot is a profit making Ltd Company which pays large dividends to Shareholders. It is NOT a registered Charity with the Charity Commission.
A requirement of the Licence should be that the operator be a registered not-for-profit Charity. The Government must act.
attributes.additional_details:
Camelot is NOT a Charity and is NOT registered with the Charity Commission. It should be a not-for-profit organisation.
Camelot's majority shareholder is a Parent Company called Premier Lotteries UK Ltd, which in turn is majority owned by a Canadian Teachers Pension Fund, specifically Ontario.
The last 2 year's dividends paid to this Canadian Pension fund (via Premier Lotteries UK Ltd) were £66.6m in 2017 and £84.2m in 2016. These are funds which could be utilised within the UK on good causes.
